definition:
Given $n$ circles which intersect $k$ times, the set of circles is
referred to as *magic circles* if there exists a numbering (using
$\{1,\ldots,k\}$) of the intersections of the $n$ circles such that the
sum of the numbers at the intersections along each circle is the same
constant for all circles.

Further reference: http://www.cgl.uwaterloo.ca/ smann/Magic/
